sn3.2:4.2: Then King Pasenadi of Kosala went up to the Buddha,
sn3.2:4.3: bowed, sat down to one side,
sn3.2:4.5: “Sir, how many things arise inside a person for their harm, suffering, and discomfort?”
sn3.2:5.1: “Great King, three things arise inside a person for their harm, suffering, and discomfort.
sn3.2:5.6: These three things arise inside a person for their harm, suffering, and discomfort.”
sn3.2:5.7: This is what the Buddha said. …
sn3.2:6.3: they harm a person of wicked heart,
sn3.2:6.4: as a reed is destroyed by its own fruit.”
